Key Match Events: Steph Curry left midway through the fourth quarter with a left ankle injury
Ivica Zubac and the Los Angeles Clippers spoiled the Golden State Warriors’ home opener with a 112-104 win
Pre-Game Insights: A moment of silence was held for Hall of Famer Al Attles, the former Warriors player, coach, general manager and ambassador who died at his East Bay home on Aug. 20 at age 87
Post-Match Reflections: Steph Curry added 18 with six assists but left for good at the 7:55 mark
James Harden contributed 23 points and 11 assists making all nine of his free throws for a Clippers team missing Kawhi Leonard as the star forward is sidelined with a right knee injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers scored 58 points in the paint — 30 by halftime
Buddy Hield went 3 for 14 — 1 of 9 from 3-point range — for eight points coming off the bench in his home debut for Golden State
Others: The Clippers return home to host Portland on Wednesday, kicking off a five-game homestand
Golden State will host New Orleans on Tuesday for the first of back-to-back games over two days against the Pelicans
